# UIContentUnavailableConfigurationState

**Structure**

A structure that encapsulates state for a content-unavailable view.

## Declaration

```swift
struct UIContentUnavailableConfigurationState
```

## Overview

Typically, you don’t create a configuration state yourself. To obtain a configuration state, override [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/updateContentUnavailableConfiguration(using:)] in your view controller subclass and use the state parameter. Outside of this method, you can get a view controller’s configuration state from the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/contentUnavailableConfigurationState-7sczw] property.

You can create your own custom states to add to a content-unavailable configuration state by defining a custom state key with [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIConfigurationStateCustomKey].

## Instance Properties

- **searchText**: The search text.

## Unavailable content configurations

- **UIContentUnavailableConfiguration**: A content configuration for a content-unavailable view.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- UIConfigurationState
